MEDIA WEATHER FORECASTER

SUMMARY

Skilled weather forecaster with experience in the media network.
Familiar with SmartMET system to make short and medium range forecasts at any spatial scale.
Highlights
Communication skills Adaptability Common software application knowledge Demonstrated organizational/planning skills
ability to improvise good performance under difficult situations team work experience reliable

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Served on a meteorological office for 6 years and as a weather office team leader for 3 years.
Completed advanced research of Severe Local Storms and Weather forecast evaluation.
Secured feature article in Cuban Meteorlogical Magazine.
Represented Cuban Weather Service in workshops and training courses in United States and China.
Attended postgraduated courses.
Participated in conferences and meetings as speaker.
Produced over 3 or 4 TV and Radio broadcasts each week for 4 straight years.
Interviewed on Television and spoke about weather forecasts, warnings an hazards.

EXPERIENCE

Media Weather Forecaster

Combined video, audio and graphics to effectively convey each report and forecast.
Effectively explained the hazards and vulnerabilities that the people could expect and confront in some dangerous weather conditions.

Analyzed the meteorological conditions affecting peoples life and economic features.

Conducted research in Severe Local Storms and Weather forecast evaluation, specifically dangerous meteorological systems.
Developed effective working relations with groups, individuals, agencies and the public.
Supervised technical and professional staff.
Guaranteed all data met stringent quality control standards.
Trained new personnel and interns on office functions.
Maintained a high rate of accuracy over a 85 % in daily forecast evaluation.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Microsoft Platform Engineer

Location: Columbus, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job#: 2025175

Job Description:

Title: Microsoft Platform Engineer

Location: Columbus, Ohio (Hybrid)

Pay Range: $74/hr- $78/hr

Contract Length: 3 months

Job Description: 

The Infrastructure Monitoring team has an established enterprise practice and is looking for an experienced engineer.

The team is responsible for enterprise infrastructure monitoring.

Selected candidate will help:

 Design, build and manage enterprise monitoring solutions from various vendors Design, build and manage tool integrations with ServiceNow and other tools. Write, document, and maintain Python scripts to perform API calls and other essential tasks. Work directly with platform engineers, infrastructure owners, architecture, and management to understand requirements and develop solutions to meet those requirements

Must Have: 

 5 years experience in installing, configuring and supporting monitoring solutions on an enterprise scale Strong understanding of large-scale applications, network architectures, micro-service architecture, monitoring and fault management Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills Experience with Zenoss, Solarwinds, Openview, or other enterprise monitoring solutions Python programming experience Demonstrated ability to work remotely. Excellent communication skills

Nice to Have: 

 Experience managing Microsoft platforms (WMI and/or WinRM, Active Directory, Exchange, Lync, IIS, SQL Server) Experience managing Hypervisors (ESX, Hyper-V, Xen) Experience profiling Web services and transactions (REST, SOAP, XML-RPC, JSON, etc) Administration, configuration, and tuning of Web Servers, App Servers, Database Servers, and Appliance Servers (Load Balancers, SSO, DataPower, etc) Strong multitasking skills Proficiency in networking technologies, configurations, and concepts Previous Financial Services experience or knowledge

EEO Employer
